summary: Robert J. Lehner is mentioned in the context of the Assassination Records Review Board's (ARRB) review of the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) staff payroll records. Specifically, one document refers to the postponed release of his payroll records due to privacy concerns related to his Social Security number. The ARRB made a final determination to postpone in part the release of HSCA staff payroll records, redacting Social Security numbers to protect personal privacy. The documents indicate that Lehner was a staff member of the HSCA.
significance: Robert J. Lehner's significance in the JFK assassination context is primarily related to his employment with the HSCA, which investigated the assassination. His payroll records were subject to review and partial postponement of release by the ARRB due to privacy concerns. The documents do not provide further details about his specific role within the HSCA.
